title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 January 2014 - XWiki

08:44 <vmassol> good morning  
08:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: FYI commons is not compiling for me but it may only be a problem on mac with my JDK  
08:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/8644528/raw/b6d413ed481b3b11996b92b0d7d09fe13b3983c6/gistfile1.txt  
08:45 <vmassol> not much you can do though…  
08:45 <tmortagne> nice  
08:46 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <tmortagne> I tough 45 was the last java 6 version  
08:47 <tmortagne> agents are using 1.6.0\_45  
08:47 <polx> has quit  
08:47 <tmortagne> (it's also what I use myself)  
08:47 <tmortagne> checking oracle website  
08:48 <tmortagne> according to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/java-archive-downloads-javase6-419409.html 45 is the last official verison so it's indeed a custom mac version

09:26 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki

09:40 <evalica> has quit  
09:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't you think we should add a {{info}}New in 5.4{{/info}} message in the Report section?  
09:40 <vmassol> (for http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/DistributionWizard )  
09:41 <tmortagne> then we need to update all others sections  
09:42 <vmassol> whenever I add some new content that's been introduced in  a new version , I always mention it because users may be using older versions  
09:42 <vmassol> for example I just added the following this morning: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XARPlugin#HFormatMojo  
09:43 <vmassol> it would be nice to find a more consistent way of doing this ofc, like some macro that would print the version referenced in a left gutter for ex  
09:49 <mstaicu> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't undertand why affects is 5.2.3 in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9932  
09:52 <vmassol> I thought wikistream import was added in 5.3  
09:52 <vmassol> ?  
09:52 <vmassol> (and not in 5.2.x)  
09:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm just too used to have the first version of the list being the last one, I did not even look at what it was  
09:53 <tmortagne> it just happen that this time the last one is an old branch...  
09:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> ok :)  
10:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think this should be indicated in the release notes of 5.3  
10:03 <vmassol> 5.3 says there's a new scalable xar import but if it's not working we need to tell the users that… well it's there but they cannot use it ;)  
10:03 <vmassol> (which shows missing functional tests btw ;))  
10:04 <tmortagne> it says there is a new experimental XAR import to be precise  
10:04 <vmassol> sure  
10:04 <vmassol> but experimental doesn't mean it cannot be used at all :)

10:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: what about XWIKI-9734 ? to be closed ? for later ?  
10:29 <vmassol> checking  
10:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <polx> has quit  
10:58 <DarkKnightCZ> any tips for "Non-resolvable parent POM for org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform:5.4-SNAPSHOT"?  
11:00 <DarkKnightCZ> it looks like artifact org.xwiki.commons-pom:pom:5.4-SNAPSHOT doesn't exist (and bad parent.relativePath)  
11:02 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: do you have the right Maven setting.xml as indicated in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HInstallingMaven ?  
11:03 <DarkKnightCZ> i don't think so (eclipse kepler for j2ee with built-in maven)  
11:03 <DarkKnightCZ> so i was following http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
11:06 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: "It is necessary that you Install & Configure Maven before trying anything here." ;)  
11:07 <tmortagne> Eclipse reuse your setting.xml  
11:07 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, right, missed that :)  
11:07 <tmortagne> that's why it's not repeated  
11:07 <tmortagne> now if it's only to build it's a lot easier and safer to build with Maven directly IMO  
11:10 <Denis1> has quit  
11:20 <woshilapin> Hi devs, is there a way to unpack XAR files into Maven?  
11:21 <tmortagne> woshilapin: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XARPlugin  
11:21 <tmortagne> but in practice a XAR is just a zip so you can use any Maven plugin handling zip files  
11:21 <woshilapin> Oh, UnXAR...  
11:22 <woshilapin> Yes, but it seems that plugin of Maven doesn't like XAR type and I don't know how to say "It's just ZIP file!"  
11:22 <woshilapin> Thanks  
11:23 <woshilapin> Oh, but only "mvn unxar" will do the job?  
11:23 <woshilapin> Because I'm trying to patch a XAR  
11:23 <woshilapin> So, I need to unzip it, patch it (with maven patch plugin), then rebuild it, is it possible?  
11:24 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Repository+Application  
11:24 <tmortagne> sorry wrong xhat  
11:25 <vmassol> :)  
11:26 <tmortagne> woshilapin: unxar unzip it wherever you want but I think xar mojo only works with a XAR project  
11:26 <tmortagne> but you can create a XAR project which use unxar, patch it and then at the end will be repackaged as XAR  
11:27 <woshilapin> OK, cool, I'll look at that  
11:27 <woshilapin> Thanks  
11:28 <tmortagne> woshilapin: you can look at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/stable-5.2.x/xwiki-enterprise-ui/xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki/pom.xml for inspiration which does something like this  
11:28 <tmortagne> it's using xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin to do its path but essentially it's the same thing as you: unxar, path, xar  
11:28 <tmortagne> s/path/patch/  
11:30 <vmassol> guys today is release day for 5.4RC1  
11:30 <vmassol> maybe we should hold commits  
11:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: ?  
11:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: gdelhumeau\_ has 2 blockers associated to him  
11:31 <the\_code`> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: couldn't he fix them after RC1 to win some time? gdelhumeau\_: how much more time do you need?  
11:32 <tmortagne> I don't like too much releasing with blockers, it defeat the purpose of a RC  
11:33 <tmortagne> in the meantime could you move/close your issues that are still associated to RC1 vmassol and mflorea  
11:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: true  
11:33 <vmassol> yep doing it  
11:33 <tmortagne> XWIKI-9595 XWIKI-9199 XCOMMONS-497  
11:35 <the\_codebot> has quit  
11:36 <the\_code`> has quit  
11:36 <the\_code`> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <vmassol> done  
11:42 <gdelhumeau\_> about XWIKI-9916 , what do we do?  
11:43 <gdelhumeau\_> XWIKI-9934 will be fixed this morning  
11:43 <gdelhumeau\_> I need tmortagne help for XWIKI-9919  
11:44 <the\_code`> has quit  
11:45 <the\_code`> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <the\_code`> has quit  
12:04 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: so maven installed and configured, eclipse now reports it found pom:5.4-SNAPSHOT, but it cannot find about 159 jar files (missing artifacts, for example xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-script:jar:5.4-20131217.155201-12), so i guess i have to import whole xwiki-platform, right? (i need to change few things in xwiki-platform-oldcore only)  
12:05 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: no you should not need to import the whole platform  
12:05 <tmortagne> did you tried to build your project with maven first ?  
12:06 <DarkKnightCZ> nope, trying now  
12:06 <tmortagne> when maven build is working then you are sure the setup is ok at least  
12:08 <tmortagne> as for xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-script I don't know why Eclipse is trying to download this precise version, 5.4-SNAPSHOT exist but not 5.4-20131217.155201-12 and nothing request this version  
12:08 <tmortagne> it should try to download 5.4-20140124.171534-46  
12:08 <tmortagne> see http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-script/5.4-SNAPSHOT/  
12:09 <DarkKnightCZ> yes... well almost every jar file had his "copy" with specified release date (SNAPSHOT + 2013/14...)  
12:10 <DarkKnightCZ> and it seems build worked (few tests threw stacktraces, but build seems to be ok)  
12:12 <mflorea> ci.xwiki.org skin is broken? is it just me?  
12:15 <tmortagne> mflorea: same here  
12:36 <vmassol> skin is ok for me right now  
12:36 <vmassol> ah no  
12:36 <vmassol> after refreshing my cahce it's not  
12:48 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <DarkKnightCZ> xwiki-platform-oldcore is xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore? (or it's missing from WEB-INF/lib ?)  
13:05 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol, mflorea, gdelhumeau\_ : can I help you somehow with testing for 5.4 RC1 ?  
13:05 <sburjan> anything you want me to look at ?  
13:06 <mflorea> like always: stuff marked as fixed in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome and http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki54RC1  
13:06 <gdelhumeau\_> sburjan: when RC1 will be released, could you check if XWIKI-9934 remain?  
13:07 <sburjan> gdelhumeau\_, okay, I've pt it in my ToDo list  
13:07 <gdelhumeau\_> thx :)  
13:09 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <cjd> is now known as <Guest14083>  
13:18 <gdelhumeau\_> sburjan: you can also see XWIKI-9893, already  
13:19 <gdelhumeau\_> and XWIKI-9893  
13:19 <gdelhumeau\_> I mean XWIKI-9347  
13:55 <DarkKnightCZ> XWikiPluginManager.getPlugins() will return classnames of all available plugins? (so XWikiPluginInterface can be retrieved by XWikiPluginManager.getPlugin(plugin name from getPlugins Method); )  
14:28 <mflorea> has quit  
14:46 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <msmeria> has quit  
14:56 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <msmeria> has quit  
15:20 <vmassol> going to restart jenkins once more  
15:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <vmassol> guys please ignore any jenkins spam, jeknins is not building in the right order  
15:57 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:58 <sburjan> Hello. Is it known that if I add a tag to a page which has translations in a lot of languages (e.g. Main.Welcome), I will hsee my tag multiple times on the same document ?  
16:00 <tmortagne> "I will hsee my tag multiple times on the same document" where ?  
16:00 <tmortagne> in any case wherever it is, known or not it's a bug  
16:01 <sburjan> yes, looks like a bug, but I can't find it reported in JIRA  
16:05 <sburjan> seems that $xwiki.tag.getDocumentsWithTag($tag))  
16:05 <sburjan>  does not return unique document names. So in my case it returns an array with a lot of "Main.Welcome" values  
16:06 <vmassol> it would need to be converted to a XWQL query and use the language filter  
16:07 <vmassol> actually it already uses the query manager  
16:07 <vmassol> so it's easy to add this filter  
16:07 <vmassol> ATM it uses only the hidden filter  
16:07 <sburjan> I don't know if this is reported in JIRA, I'm sure this is an ancient issue  
16:07 <sburjan> but if not, I want to report it  
16:08 <vmassol> sburjan: I'd report it if I were you  
16:08 <sburjan> vmassol: okay, reporting it  
16:09 <vmassol> it's really easy to fix, only issue is to decide if we're ok to break the API or not  
16:09 <vmassol> (ie add a new API or not)  
16:09 <mstaicu> We could add a new method which takes a list as a first argument and a second parameter which is a boolean  
16:10 <mstaicu> Returning only the translations with the default language of the wiki  
16:10 <vmassol> yes that's the new API option  
16:10 <vmassol> which is the safest  
16:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: when you don't find something report it, if someone knows the other one you did not found he will link it as duplicate  
16:12 <vmassol> a good issue to fix during the next BFD ;)  
16:12 <sburjan> yes, just wanted to create as less mess on jira as possible, this is why I asked :0  
16:12 <tmortagne> sburjan: you searched, it's already good ;)  
16:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: would be great if we could release 5.4RC1 before Thursday so that all work for 5.x would continue on a branch and master would become 6.0-m1  
16:12 <vmassol> (and BFD would happen on master by default)  
16:13 <vmassol> (a bit more work for those working on 5.x but at least it should be safer for the stabilization work)  
16:19 <sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9938 reported  
16:19 <vmassol> thanks sburjan  
16:22 <mstaicu> about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9938  
16:22 <mstaicu> Do you agree on adding on this line  
16:22 <mstaicu> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-tag/xwiki-platform-tag-api/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/tag/TagQueryUtils.java#L178  
16:23 <mstaicu> The following addFilter("currentlanguage") ?  
16:23 <mstaicu> If the boolean argument is true ( second argument for the new method )  
16:25 <ClemensR> could this cause not to show the document if it has the tag but no translation for the "current language", whatever it is?  
16:31 <vmassol> mstaicu: yes but in a new method as to not break the existing API  
16:32 <vmassol> the only problem  
16:32 <vmassol> is that from an api pov it's better to list only tags for the current language if nothing is specified and have a allTags boolean to list all tags  
16:33 <vmassol> this can be done with 2 new apis and a deprecation of the old api  
16:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki

17:48 <gdelhumeau\_> or add authenticate\_delete=yes in xwiki.properties  
17:52 <gdelhumeau\_> Maybe 2) is cleaner...
